oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Educational facilities
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee; Rosenwald, Julius, 1862-1932
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front and partial side views of Hohenwald Rosenwald School in Lewis County. White building has multiple windows.

Opened in July 1929 with funding from the Rosenwald Foundation, this school for African American children of Hohenwald consisted of two classrooms, restrooms, and a kitchen. It served grades one through eight, replacing the old Hohenwald school for "colored" children. The institution closed in the mid-1960s.
